sentences.english: The launch of the iPad in 2010 triggered a new round of innovation in the startup community.
sentences.chinese: 2010年iPad的問市推動了新一輪的創新浪潮。

sentences.english: Let me give you some examples of how Merrill is riding that next wave.
sentences.chinese: 讓我舉幾個美林如何駕御下一個浪潮的事例。

sentences.english: An egg which is free from a foetus is the wave tide which wants quilt time to flush a discard.
sentences.chinese: 一個不受胎的蛋，是要被時間的浪潮沖刷成廢物的。

sentences.english: Although the wind turned the tides time and time again against him.
sentences.chinese: 儘管風捲得如浪潮一樣一次又一次地阻擋他。

sentences.english: The faster the waves come, the more deliberately we need to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 浪潮來的越快，我們越是需要有意識地辨明方向。

sentences.english: The lightest feet between heaven and earth, so that we vaguely hear the waves and the Ocean Waves.
sentences.chinese: 天地間最輕的腳步，使我們依稀聽到浪潮和濤聲。

sentences.english: Among lolich the material is always the one to start the fashion reform.
sentences.chinese: 而每一次掀起服裝改革浪潮的都是面料。

sentences.english: Almost every way of life in the medieval period was washed away by the tide of change.
sentences.chinese: 改革浪潮盪滌了中世紀生活的幾乎每個方面。

sentences.english: Against this background, Inspur Communication needs to develop the company's development strategy.
sentences.chinese: 在此背景下，浪潮通信急需制定公司的發展戰略。

sentences.english: The music of the tide is rising high. You are shaken by the fever of that dance.
sentences.chinese: 浪潮高卷，轟鳴接天，熱烈的狂舞震撼着你。

sentences.english: Day after day my men and I straggle to hold back a tidal wave of crime.
sentences.chinese: 一天又一天，我和我的人努力抑制罪惡的浪潮。

sentences.english: So far, there hasn't been a groundswell of anti-nuclear demonstrations.
sentences.chinese: 到目前爲止，還沒有反核示威浪潮。

sentences.english: Along with the economic globalization, the times of knowledge-based economy is coming.
sentences.chinese: 隨着經濟全球化浪潮的洶湧，知識經濟時代早已到來。

sentences.english: Could a changing climate cause similarly big ebbs and flows?
sentences.chinese: 氣候變化是否同樣會引起移民浪潮大起大落？

sentences.english: There's a new wave art show currently on exhibit up at the local college gallery.
sentences.chinese: 本地大學美術館里正在舉辦一個新浪潮藝術作品展。

sentences.english: The reform bandwagon swept across the country.

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
